name: Ramadan
description: Fasting in the month of Ramadan is one of the five pillars of Islam for those who are able.
notes: Use this app to see approximate Ramadan days.
Always confirm start and end with your local scholars and moon-sighting.

name: Mondays and Thursdays
description: The Prophet ﷺ used to fast on Mondays and Thursdays.
notes: Use the calendar to find Mondays and Thursdays in each week.
Plan voluntary fasts around your schedule when possible.

name: Ayyam al-Beed (White Days)
description: 13th, 14th and 15th of each Hijri month are known as the white days.
notes: Check the Hijri date in the Day View to identify these days.
Many Muslims fast these days regularly every month.

name: Day of Arafah (for non–Hajj pilgrims)
description: Fasting on the 9th of Dhul-Hijjah is strongly recommended for those not performing Hajj.
notes: Use this app to see when Dhul-Hijjah is approaching.
Many people increase dua, dhikr and charity on this day.

name: Ashura (10 Muharram)
description: Fasting the 10th of Muharram (Ashura) is highly recommended. Many scholars encourage fasting a day before or after.
notes: Consider fasting 9th and 10th or 10th and 11th, based on scholarly advice.
Use the Hijri date in the app to identify Muharram days.

name: Six days of Shawwal
description: After completing Ramadan, fasting six days in Shawwal brings great reward.
notes: You can spread the six days across the month of Shawwal.
Use the calendar to plan around work and family commitments.
